author: Tediousity
title: Weird but good
review:
This guy is odd. I mean, he's literally dressed like a pencil! But he's also a really cool figure. His headpiece is an entirely new mold which has a slight yellow bit on the bottom, lessening its play value slightly, but it has a stud on top which you put the 1x1 pink round tile on. He's got penciltips printed on his feet and lines on every part of his body.  His paper is kind of funny but rather odd.

All in all, great! I might use the torso and legs for a Number Two (Mysterious Benedict Society) MOC figure.

author: 8BrickMario
title: Surprisingly NOT erased from memory!
review:
This is an oddball choice, but this guy is a very real Batman rogue who goes way back. Is he just a silly novelty or a worthy addition to the rogues gallery?

 

Parts

His parts are fairly limited, but his torso and head piece could be applied to different situations.

 

The Minifigure

The Eraser is Lenny Fiasco, a former classmate of Bruce Wayne's, who serves as a behind-the-scenes guy who destroys evidence and covers up crimes. His pencil-themed costume is delightfully ridiculous, and it starts with his helmet. This is a new piece which includes the silver eraser guard and the yellow section at the neck, and it has two circular eyes printed on it. The piece is topped off by a pink tile. I like the look of this, but it feels odd that the head is narrower than a minifigure head- it doesn't look like a convincing helmet, and I thought he was a robot because of it.

His outfit is a pinstriped yellow suit with a black cravat and gloves. On his toes are an original detail- designs representing the drawing end of a pencil!

His accessory is a yet-to-be-filled to-erase list printed on a 2x2 tile. I wish they had actually listed some items.

 

Overall

I'd recommend him. He's a shining example of the silly fun comics have, and it's a sign of the desperately-needed humor that this movie is bringing back to DC.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Holy Obscure Villains Batman
review:
Set #71017 Eraser: A villain from DC Comics I don't know a whole lot about, The LEGO Batman Movie decided to include as many of them as possible, and Eraser is a fairly interesting looking minifigure.

Dressed in an orange striped suit, Eraser features some very unique printing, his feet even have the standard looking Number 2 Pencil led printed on the front, in fact he looks like a walking Number 2 Pencil considering the eraser tip for a head. Eraser is quirky looking and fun, and would fit in nicely with the odd costumed characters we've gotten in the past.

Overall a pretty odd-ball figure that looks quite charming, his little To Erase list, which seems to be finished with, is a fun little bonus. I strongly recommend him, especially for his unique printed parts.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: A comically obscure character turned into a brilliantly unique Minifigure!
review:
Opening;

The Eraser is a DC villain I was surprisingly familiar with before the release of the 'LEGO Batman Movie' and I always loved his design, and is Minifigure variant is brilliant in representing the goofy character and making a fun minifig.

The Minifigure-

He has a 1×1 pink round tile for the eraser/rubber part of his head, a unique dual moulded head for a pencil topper with eyes printed, his torso is almost pin-stripes running down including his arms, his legs also have this detail continuing even on the sides, along with the feet having the pencil too printed.

The accessory -

His singular included accessory is a 2×2 white tile with a notepad print claiming 'To Erase' which isn't very useful. The stand is the standard black CMF stand.

In conclusion -

This is a great Minifigure with no flaws however, the accessory is not very good as its uses are restricted heavily, anyway I highly recommend this Minifigure to DC fans alike.
